Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 09:07AM beckyp wrote: Thanks Randi and Pamela!   It is interesting to be thrown into this "club" but amazing how wonderul and supportive everyone is.  All the survivors I've talked to really want to share their stories and it is very encouraging.  At first I was so panicked (sp?) and wanted everything done right away.  I have learned about being patient and that having more time has been a good thing.  I had a lumpectomy in Feb. but the doc needed to "clear the margins" plus they found another small cancer.  The consensus ended up being I needed a mastectomy as I wouldn't get a good "cosmetic outcome", meaning I was small to begin with and wouldn't have anything left after radiation:)  I decided to do the other side also to avoid having to worry and go through this again.  Whew!  My breasts served me and my kids well, but I want my life back!!!! Have a great day, Becky

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 10:22PM - edited Mar 15, 2011 11:28PM by beckyp I'm also an April girl...I'm having a bi-lateral mastectomy with reconstruction on April 20th.  I was told today that I don't have to do chemo, but I've learned not to get my hopes up too much after many surprises in the past few months!  I also work for a hospice here, which has been challenging at times.  It's nice to read about others who are also on this roller coaster.  Thanks for listening:)
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 07:29PM beckyp wrote: I had a double mastectomy on 4/20 and got one drain out yesterday and hope to have the other out this Monday.  So far, so good with recovery.  I'm giving myself another week and a half off of work, if I don't go stir crazy before that.  Being home has been a challenge for me, as well as not over doing it.  I do get tired easily, but am trying to get out and do something every day.  Being able to take a shower is wonderful and I'm sleeping pretty well.  The plastic surgeon said I'll need a couple of fills to the expanders and then have the implants put in 4-6 weeks after the original surgery.  I'm hoping they will be more comfortable than the expanders!  Even though I have a lot of support, this feels like a lonely road.  After thinking about surgery and all the build up to that, it's almost a let down now.  Does that sound familiar to anyone else?  I am so glad it is behind me, though I know I still have a ways to go.  Hope you all are doing well!
